700399f-a.text:
179 to 183 (left to right) Alexander Ave., west side, between
East 135th and East 136th Streets.
About 1923.
W. B. Vernam.

700048f-a.text:
East 135th Street (extreme left), south side, east from the Third Ave. Elevated Line, between Alexander and Willis Aves., showing the cleared area created by the demolition of buildings that formerly stood there to facilitate the construction of the approach to the Triborough Bridge. The clearance extends south to East 134th Street (extreme
right) on which buildings are seen.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as viewed eastward from Willis Ave.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
An additional view of the clearance as viewed in a southeasterly direction. The buildings prominently shown extending from the center to the right bear Nos. 136 to 124 Willis Ave., east side, south from
East 134th Street to Southern Boulevard.

700047f-a.text:
(1)
East 135th Street (extreme left), east from a point between Alexander and Willis Aves. (the Third Avenue Elevated line), showing the clearance between East 134th and East 135th Streets which is being constructed into the westerly approach to the
Triborough Bridge.
November 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
November 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A more extensive view of the same, and including East 134th
Street (right).
November 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
